newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: U.S. firm wins phone tender in Mauritius.
newsitem.headline: U.S. firm wins phone tender in Mauritius.

text.p: U.S. company Qualcomm Corp has won a tender to install 50,000 wireless local loop (WLL) telephone lines in the Indian Ocean island of Mauritius, a senior (Mauritius) Central Tender Board official said.
The official said Qualcomm bid 1.1 billion rupees ($53.89 million) for the project, ahead of fellow American company Motorola Inc. He would not say what Motorola's bid was.
